amendment.description: Amendment prohibits the government of Haiti from receiving any funds after March 1, 1996 if the President determines that the Haitian government is controlled by a regime holding power through nondemocratic means.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 5 in part 2 of House Rept. 104-147, to prohibit, effective March 1, 1996, as modified, to prohibit the use of any funds for assistance to Haiti when the President of the U.S. is informed that the government of Haiti is controlled by a a regime holding power through means other than the democratic elections scheduled for calendar year 1995 and held in substantial compliance with the provisions of that country's constitution of 1987.

action.text: Goss amendment (A023) modified by unanimous consent. Prohibiting the use of any funds appropriated in the bill for assistance to Haiti when the President of the U.S. is informed that the government of Haiti is controlled by a regime holding power through means other than the democratic elections scheduled for calendar year 1995 and held in substantial compliance with the provisions of that country's constitution of 1987.
On agreeing to the Goss amendment (A023) as modified Agreed to by recorded vote: 252 - 164, 1 Present (Roll no. 441).
